page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY HAREWOOD IS BEST KNOWN FOR 'HAREWOOD HOUSE', THE HOME OF THE EARL AND COUNTESS OF HAREWOOD. HAREWOOD WAS MENTIONED IN THE ORIGINAL DOMESDAY BOOK OF 1086. 'TOR, SPROT AND GRIM, THREE SAXON CHIEFTAINS, HAD TEN CARACUTES OF LAND TO BE TAXED - A CARACUTE OF LAND AT THAT TIME BEING ABOUT AS MUCH LAND AS COULD BE WORKED BY ONE PLOUGH IN A YEAR'. THE NAME HAREWOOD HAS BEEN GIVEN MANY DERIVATIONS, 'HARE'S WOOD' TO HAERH (ANGLO-SAXON) MEANING A TEMPLE. OLD DOCUMENTS SHOW IT AS BEING SPELLED AS HARWOOD.
